> What's the difference between the Web and a distributed filesystem such
> as Plan 9's 9P or Amoeba's Bullet File System?

A shared data model between client and server for directories,
metadata, and content.  Basically, the same as the difference
between REST and Alex's notion of MoST, which is why I said he
might as well use a distributed file system.

> Who says distributed filesystems don't have generic interfaces?

Sorry, I should have said "REST's definitions of resource and
representation" rather than "generic interface".  I was talking
about that specific interface, not the notion in general.

....Roy
